subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h4|color:%23000000" subtitle_font_options="tag:h4"]Asset Allocation: When Conventional Wisdom Fails[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]Is diversification a flawed concept? Should you always play it safe with your retirement savings? What's your most important investment decision? Can we forecast the future in capital markets? This presentation will dispel myths in asset allocation. Sebastien Page's book, "Beyond Diversification," relies on over 200 academic papers, investment insights from his colleagues, his 20+ years of experience in investment management, and wisdom from his father. In addition to addressing some of the big questions in asset allocation, Sebastien will discuss the current investment environment. He will address the impact of low interest rates, and whether the 60/40 portfolio is "dead".[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20the%20pros%20forecast%20returns%20and%20risks%20in%20capital%20markets%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20to%20make%20better%20asset%20allocation%20decisions%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22%5Cn%20How%20to%20increase%20your%20odds%20of%20success%20in%20investing%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Sebastien Page is head of the Global Multi-Asset Division. He oversees a team of investment professionals dedicated to actively managing a broad set of Muti-asset portfolios representing more than $363 billion in assets including the firm's target date franchise. He is a member of the Asset Allocation Committee, which is responsible for tactical investment decisions across asset allocation portfolios. Sebastien's investment experience began in 2000, and he has been with T. Rowe Price since 2015. Sebastien coauthored award-winning research papers for The Journal of Portfolio Management in 2003, 2010, and 2011 and the Financial Analysts Journal in 2010 and 2014. He is the author of the book "Beyond Diversification: What Every Investor Needs to Know About Asset Allocation" and coauthor of the book "Factor Investing and Asset Allocation". Sebastien is a member of the editorial board of the Financial Analysts Journal. He regularly appears on CNBC and Bloomberg TV.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column css=".vc_custom_1528420010170{padding-right: 5% ARCHIVE MATERIALS

[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_button button_text="Webinar Recording" main_style="style-2" undefined="" box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" hover_box_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" buttom_link_src="url:https%3A%2F%2Fyoutu.be%2Fe4QWF_lnHZE||target:%20_blank|"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/2" css=".vc_custom_1528420045018{padding-right: 5% !important;padding-left: 5% !important;}" col_shadow="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)" col_shadow_hover="box_shadow_enable:disable|shadow_horizontal:0|shadow_vertical:15|shadow_blur:50|shadow_spread:0|box_shadow_color:rgba(0%2C0%2C0%2C0.35)"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][dfd_heading subtitle="" delimiter_settings="delimiter_style:solid|delimiter_width:0|delimiter_height:1" undefined="" title_font_options="tag:h2" subtitle_font_options="tag:div"]Good Riddance to 2020: Economic & Market Outlook, 2021 and Beyond[/dfd_heading][vc_column_text]2020 brought unprecedented disruption to the entire world economy, and a stunning 34% drop in the stock market in a matter of weeks. Since then, the markets have rebounded, shot past new highs, and the global economy is projected to grow at a faster rate than at any time since rebounding off the recession of 1979/1980. Michael Farr teases the threads of globalization, technology, monetary largesse, and rebounding demand to give his thoughts on where new opportunities -and emerging threats- lie in the post pandemic world.[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text]
You will learn...
[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][dfd_icon_list module_animation="transition.slideRightBigIn" list_fields="%5B%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22How%20will%20globalization%2C%20technology%2C%20and%20monetary%20largesse%20shape%20the%20economy%20and%20the%20stock%20market%2C%20in%20a%20post%20pandemic%20world%3F%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22What%20are%20the%20opportunities%20that%20lie%20ahead%20for%20investors%20going%20forward%3F%22%7D%2C%7B%22icon_type%22%3A%22selector%22%2C%22select_icon%22%3A%22dfd_icons%22%2C%22ic_dfd_icons%22%3A%22dfd-socicon-arrow-pointing-to-right%22%2C%22text_content%22%3A%22What%20are%20the%20threats%20that%20investors%20need%20to%20watch%20out%20for%20in%20order%20to%20protect%20their%20portfolios%3F%22%7D%5D" icon_border="border_style:none|border_color:%2334d288" main_style="style-1" icon_size="20" icon_color="#5e67bb" font_options="tag:h6|color:%2334d288"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][vc_column_text]Michael K. Farr is President and majority owner of Farr, Miller & Washington, LLC. He is Chairman of the Investment Committee and is responsible for overseeing the day to day activities of the firm. Prior to starting FM&W, he was a Principal with Alex Brown & Sons. Mr. Farr is a paid Contributor for CNBC television and has appeared on The Today Show, Good Morning America, NBC Nightly News, CNN, Bloomberg, Reuters, and the Nightly Business Report. Mr. Farr is heard on Associated Press Radio and National Public Radio, and has been quoted in the Wall Street Journal, Forbes, Fortune, The Washington Post, Businessweek, USA Today, and many other publications. He is a member of the Economic Club of Washington, DC, National Association for Business Economics, The World Presidents' Organization, and The Washington Association of Money Managers. He is the author of "A Million is Not Enough" and "The Arrogance Cycle". [/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="20" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="15" screen_tablet_spacer_size="15" screen_mobile_spacer_size="10"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column][vc_separator color="blue"][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row][vc_column width="1/6"][vc_column_text][/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="2/3"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][vc_column_text css=".vc_custom_1606088710151{background-color: #b5ffb6 !important;}"]

You can help during this pandemic emergency period,Â 

please consider making a voluntary $10 or $15 contribution to

AAII's LA Chapter. To donate online (CLICK HERE) Thank you!

[/vc_column_text][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][vc_column width="1/6"][dfd_spacer screen_wide_spacer_size="40" screen_normal_resolution="1024" screen_tablet_resolution="800" screen_mobile_resolution="480" screen_normal_spacer_size="30" screen_tablet_spacer_size="20" screen_mobile_spacer_size="15"][/vc_column][/vc_row]
item.excerpt:encoded: Financial Education meeting information that focuses on the broad overview of basic individual investing in today's market.
